newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK Telecom hits 1997 high after results.
newsitem.headline: HK Telecom hits 1997 high after results.

text.p: Hong Kong Telecommunications Ltd shares shot up to a 1997 high in Thursday afternoon trade, boosted by better-than-expected annual results and speculation that a China partner may buy a stake in the company.

The stock was up HK$0.50 at HK$14.70 after reaching a 1997 high of HK$14.80 following the release of results for the year to March 31 which showed a 12.5 percent rise in net profit to HK$11.18 billion and a 10.8 percent rise in turnover to HK$32.58 billion.
"It seems like they probably cut costs a lot more than we expected," said an analyst with a European brokerage.
He had predicted net profits of less than HK$11 billion.
"The results are better than I expected, which was around HK$11 billion," said another analyst.
Profits were slightly ahead of the consensus forecast in the Estimate Directory, which predicted HK$11.144 billion in net earnings.

Hongkong Telecom shares had finished the morning session at HK$14.35 with investors reacting positively to news reports that China United Telecommunications Corp (China Unicom) had held talks with Cable & Wireless about buying a stake in the company.
